alert.note: Alert for Henry; Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 12 at 4:32PM CDT until May 12 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 PM EDT/500 PM CDT/ FOR SOUTHEASTERN HENRY AND NORTHEASTERN HOUSTON COUNTIES IN SOUTHEASTERN ALABAMA...NORTHWESTERN MILLER...SOUTHEASTERN CLAY...SOUTHWESTERN CALHOUN AND EARLY COUNTIES IN SOUTHWESTERN GEORGIA... At 532 PM EDT/432 PM CDT/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 10 miles west of Edison to near Blakely to 6 miles south of Columbia to near Cowarts, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Blakely, Ashford, Cowarts, Edison, Arlington, Columbia, Centerville, Avon, Gordon, Bellville, Bluffton, Memphis, Saffold, Pansey, Parksville, Hayes, Wilson Mill, Mayhaw, Rock Hill and Keytons. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
